meanings.definition: To ease or alleviate pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: Taking a warm bath can be very relieving after a long day.
meanings.sent2: The medicine did a great job relieving her headache.
meanings.sent3: The relieving massage made her feel like she was floating on a cloud.
meanings.sent4: His kind words were like a relieving balm to her wounded heart.
meanings.sent5: The cool breeze was relieving on the hot summer day.

meanings.sent1: She found the relieving presence of her friend very comforting.
meanings.sent2: The cozy blanket was so relieving on the chilly evening.
meanings.sent3: The relieving hug from her mom made everything better.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a relieving embrace in a time of need.
meanings.sent5: The relieving smile on his face warmed her heart.

meanings.definition: To free from a burden or obligation.
meanings.sent1: Paying off the debt was a relieving moment for him.
meanings.sent2: She felt a weight lifted off her shoulders, relieving her stress.
meanings.sent3: The relieving news of the canceled meeting made his day.
meanings.sent4: Letting go of the past was like relieving a heavy anchor.
meanings.sent5: The relieving feeling of freedom washed over him as he walked away.
